# isNumber

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value indicating whether this character represents a number.

## Declaration

```swift
var isNumber: Bool { get }
```

## Discussion

For example, the following characters all represent numbers:

- ‚Äú7‚Äù (U+0037 DIGIT SEVEN)
- ‚Äú‚Öö‚Äù (U+215A VULGAR FRACTION FIVE SIXTHS)
- ‚Äú„äà‚Äù (U+3288 CIRCLED IDEOGRAPH NINE)
- ‚Äúùü†‚Äù (U+1D7E0 MATHEMATICAL DOUBLE-STRUCK DIGIT EIGHT)
- ‚Äú‡πí‚Äù (U+0E52 THAI DIGIT TWO)

## Checking a Character‚Äôs Numeric Properties

- **isWholeNumber**: A Boolean value indicating whether this character represents a whole number.
- **wholeNumberValue**: The numeric value this character represents, if it represents a whole number.
- **isHexDigit**: A Boolean value indicating whether this character represents a hexadecimal digit.
- **hexDigitValue**: The numeric value this character represents, if it is a hexadecimal digit.
